message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the reflection of light and the properties of the arctic environment. The arctic environment appears white because it is covered in white precipitation, such as snow and ice. This white surface reflects all colors from the closest star, which is the sun. Option (A) is incorrect because the arctic is not covered in prisms. Option (C) is incorrect because it does not rain all the time in the arctic. Option (D) is incorrect because the ground is not covered with white animals.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the reflection of light and the characteristics of the arctic environment. The arctic environment is covered in white precipitation, such as snow and ice. White surfaces have the property of reflecting all colors of light, rather than absorbing them. Therefore, the arctic environment mostly reflects all colors from the closest star, which is the sun. Option (A) is incorrect because prisms are not naturally occurring in the arctic environment. Option (C) is incorrect because the arctic environment does not always have rain. Option (D) is incorrect because while there may be white animals in the arctic, the entire ground is not completely covered with them.
